00016 /// Provides the Machine class.

00018 #ifndef __MACHINE_HPP
00019 #define __MACHINE_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 #include <data.hpp>
00023 #include <stack.hpp>

00033 /// A virtual machine.
00034 /**
00035  * \note This class is \ref extending "extensible".
00036  */
00037 class Machine : public MachineExtension {
00038     
00039     public:
00040         
00041         /// The ID of this Machine.
00042         MachineId id;
00043         
00044         /// The standard stack.
00045         Stack<Data> stack;
00046         
00047         /// The environment stack.
00048         Stack<Data> environment;
00049         
00050         /// The globals.
00051         Stack<Data> globals;
00052         
00053         /// The threads.
00054         /**
00055          * \see Thread
00056          */
00057         Array<Thread> threads;
00058         
00059         /// The (index of the) current thread when executing a run.
00060         /**
00061          * When not running, this is the index of the thread that will be checked first for the next run.
00062          */
00063         Thread::Id current_thread;
00064         
00065         /// The state variables.
00066         Array<State> state;
00067         
00068         /// The list of all the neighbours.
00069         NeighbourHood hood;
00070         
00071     protected:
00072         
00073         /// A pointer to the next instruction.
00074         Address instruction_pointer;
00075         
00076         /// Boolean indicating whether execution (installation or a single run) has finished.
00077         bool is_finished;
00078         
00079         /// The callback stack.
00080         /**
00081          * \see call
00082          * \see retn
00083          */
00084         Stack<Instruction> callbacks;
00085         
00086         /// The current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00087         /**
00088          * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00089          */
00090         NeighbourHood::iterator current_neighbour;
00091         
00092         friend void Instructions::DEF_VM(Machine &);
00093 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00094         friend void Instructions::DEF_VM_EX(Machine &);
00095 #endif
00096         friend void Instructions::EXIT(Machine &);
00097         friend class HoodInstructions;
00098         
00099     public:
00100         
00101         /// The constructor.
00102         Machine() : instruction_pointer(0), callbacks(1) {}
00103         
00104         /// \name Execution control
00105         /// \{
00106             
00107             /// Start an installation script.
00108             /**
00109              * \note This does not execute the installation script, it only prepares it. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00110              * 
00111              * \param script A pointer to the installation script.
00112              */
00113             inline void install(Int8 const * script) {
00114                 is_finished = false;
00115                 jump(Address(script));
00116                 callbacks.push(0);
00117             }
00118             
00119             /// Start the next scheduled task.
00120             /**
00121              * \note This does not execute Proto code, it only prepares the next run. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00122              */
00123             inline void run() {
00124                 is_finished = true;
00125                 for(Size i = 0; i < threads.size(); i++){
00126                     if (threads[current_thread].pending()){
00127                         threads[current_thread].untrigger();
00128                         jump(globals.peek(current_thread).asAddress());
00129                         callbacks.push(run_callback);
00130                         is_finished = false;
00131                         return;
00132                     }
00133                     current_thread++;
00134                     if (current_thread >= threads.size()) current_thread = 0;
00135                 }
00136             }
00137             
00138         protected:
00139             static void run_callback(Machine & machine){
00140                 machine.threads[machine.current_thread].result = machine.stack.pop();
00141                 for(Size i = 0; i < machine.state.size(); i++){
00142                     if (machine.state[i].thread == machine.current_thread){
00143                         if (!machine.state[i].is_executed) machine.state[i].data.reset();
00144                         machine.state[i].is_executed = false;
00145                     }
00146                 }
00147                 machine.current_thread++;
00148                 if (machine.current_thread >= machine.threads.size()) machine.current_thread = 0;
00149             }
00150             
00151         public:
00152             /// Execute the next instruction.
00153             /**
00154              * \note Do not use this function when already finished().
00155              */
00156             inline void step() {
00157                 execute(instructions[nextInt8()]);
00158             }
00159             
00160             /// Check whether the running script (installation or a single run) has finished (true) or not (false).
00161             inline bool finished() {
00162                 return callbacks.empty();
00163             }
00164             
00165         /// \}
00166         
00167         /// \name Control flow
00168         /// \{
00169             
00170             /// Jump to another address.
00171             /**
00172              * \param address The address to jump to.
00173              */
00174             inline void jump(Address address) {
00175                 instruction_pointer = address;
00176             }
00177             
00178             /// Advance the instruction pointer.
00179             /**
00180              * \param distance The number of bytes to skip.
00181              */
00182             inline void skip(Size distance) {
00183                 instruction_pointer += distance;
00184             }
00185             
00186             /// Call a function.
00187             /**
00188              * \param address The address of the first instruction of the function.
00189              * \param callback Called when the function returns.
00190              */
00191             inline void call(Address address, Instruction callback = 0) {
00192                 callbacks.push(callback);
00193                 stack.push(instruction_pointer);
00194                 jump(address);
00195             }
00196             
00197             /// Return from a function.
00198             /**
00199              * If the corresponding call (if any) registered a callback, it will be called.
00200              * 
00201              * \see Instructions::RET
00202              */
00203             inline void retn() {
00204                 Instruction callback = callbacks.pop();
00205                 Data result = stack.pop();
00206                 if (!callbacks.empty()) jump(stack.popAddress());
00207                 if (!(callbacks.empty() && !callback)) stack.push(result);
00208                 if (callback) callback(*this);
00209             }
00210             
00211             /// Get the current address (instruction pointer).
00212             inline Address currentAddress() const {
00213                 return instruction_pointer;
00214             }
00215             
00216             /// Get the callback depth.
00217             /**
00218              * Usually 1, but higher inside instructions such as \ref Instructions::INIT_FEEDBACK "INIT_FEEDBACK" or \ref Instructions::TUP_MAP "TUP_MAP".
00219              */
00220             inline Counter depth() const {
00221                 return callbacks.size();
00222             }
00223             
00224         /// \}
00225         
00226         /// \name Low level
00227         /// \{
00228             
00229             /// Read the next byte(s) as an unsigned integer.
00230             /**
00231              * Using the Variable Length Quantity (VLQ)
00232              * format as used in the MIDI file format.
00233              * 
00234              * \see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variable-length_quantity
00235              */
00236             inline Int nextInt() {
00237                 Int value = 0;
00238                 while(true){
00239                     Int8 next = *instruction_pointer++;
00240                     value |= next & 0x7F;
00241                     if (next & 0x80) value <<= 7;
00242                     else break;
00243                 }
00244                 return value;
00245             }
00246             
00247             /// Read the next byte as an unsigned 8-bit integer.
00248             /**
00249              * \deprecated Use nextInt() instead.
00250              */
00251             inline Int8 nextInt8() {
00252                 return *instruction_pointer++;
00253             }
00254             
00255             /// Read the next two bytes as an unsigned 16-bit integer (big endian).
00256             /**
00257              * \deprecated Use nextInt() instead.
00258              */
00259             inline Int16 nextInt16() {
00260                 Int16 data  = static_cast<Int16>(nextInt8()) << 8;
00261                       data += nextInt8();
00262                 return data;
00263             }
00264             
00265             /// Execute an instruction.
00266             /**
00267              * \param instruction The Instruction to execute.
00268              * 
00269              * \see Instructions
00270              */
00271             inline void execute(Instruction instruction) {
00272                 instruction(*this);
00273             }
00274             
00275         /// \}
00276         
00277         /// \name Neighbour methods
00278         /// \{
00279             
00280             /// Get the current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00281             /**
00282              * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00283              */
00284             inline Neighbour & currentNeighbour() {
00285                 return *current_neighbour;
00286             }
00287             
00288             /// Get the Neighbour representing this machine.
00289             inline Neighbour & thisMachine() {
00290                 return *hood.begin();
00291             }
00292             
00293         /// \}
00294 };
00295 
00296 #endif
